Uni Eropa Bersama Pemprov Jabar Bahas Kerja Sama Bidang Pendidikan
05 Nov 2019, 02:57 by Tempo.co
INFO JABARâ€“ Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat (Pemprov Jabar) bekerja sama dengan Uni Eropa di bidang pendidikan kepariwisataan. Tujuannya untuk mendukung pengembangan Sumber Daya Manusia (SDM) di sektor pariwisata berstandar internasional.
Bentuk kerja sama yang sudah dilakukan antara lain, Uni Eropa, menggelar European Higher Education Fair (EHEF) di Sasana Budaya Ganesa Bandung pada Selasa, 5 November 2019. Acara tersebut membuka peluang kerja sama bagi universitas di Jabar dengan Universitas di Eropa di bidang pendidikan tinggi untuk program pertukaran pelajar.
Pembahasan kerja sama dilanjutkan dengan pertemuan antara Penjabat (Pj.) Sekretaris Daerah (Sekda) Provinsi Jawa Barat (Jabar) Daud Achmad dengan European Union (EU) Ambassador Vincent Piket di Ruang Lokantara Gedung Sate, Kota Bandung, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Pertemuan itu juga membahas potensi kerja sama melalui program bantuan pinjaman di sektor energi, lingkungan, dan pembangunan berkelanjutan terutama bagi Jabar.
Terkait kerja sama di bidang pendidikan, menurut Daud, Kampus Unpad di Pangandaran bisa dioptimalkan sebagai laboratorium tersebut. Karena Jabar tengah merevitalisasi Pantai Barat dan Timur Pangandaran untuk menjadikan Pangandaran sebagai Kabupaten Wisata.
Selain itu, Jabar juga ingin bekerja sama dalam pengembangan pendidikan vokasi untuk meningkatkan standardisasi keahlian internasional, termasuk sustainable tourism (pariwisata berkelanjutan).
Menanggapi Daud, Vincent menyatakan bahwa Uni Eropa terus mengkaji potensi kerja sama dengan Jabar. "Kerja sama internasional antara universitas (di Indonesia dan Eropa) bagus bagi kedua pihak karena itu menguatkan kualitas program studi dan penelitian," ucap Vincent. (*)

European Union With West Java Provincial Government Discuss Cooperation in Education
05 Nov 2019, 02:57 by Tempo.co
INFO JABAR - The Government of West Java Province (West Java Provincial Government) cooperates with the European Union in the field of tourism education. The aim is to support the development of Human Resources (HR) in the international standard tourism sector.
Forms of cooperation that have been carried out, among others, the European Union, held the European Higher Education Fair (EHEF) at Sasana Budaya Ganesha Bandung on Tuesday, November 5, 2019. The event opened opportunities for cooperation for universities in West Java with European Universities in the field of higher education for student exchange programs.
The discussion of the collaboration continued with a meeting between the Acting (Acting) Regional Secretary (Sekda) of West Java Province (Jabar) Daud Achmad with the European Union (EU) Ambassador Vincent Piket in the Lokantara Room Gedung Sate, Bandung City, Monday, 4 November 2019.
The meeting also discussed the potential for cooperation through loan assistance programs in the energy, environment and sustainable development sectors, especially for West Java.
Regarding cooperation in the field of education, according to Daud, Unpad Campus in Pangandaran can be optimized as a laboratory. Because West Java is revitalizing the West and East Coasts of Pangandaran to make Pangandaran as a Tourism District.
In addition, West Java also wants to work together in the development of vocational education to improve the standardization of international expertise, including sustainable tourism.
Responding to David, Vincent stated that the European Union continued to review the potential for cooperation with West Java. "International cooperation between universities (in Indonesia and Europe) is good for both parties because it strengthens the quality of study and research programs," Vincent said. (*)
